intro: Corunastylis fimbriata, commonly known as the fringed threadleaf, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers. The leaves are narrow and often have a fringed appearance, giving the plant its common name. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. The flowers are usually pale blue or purple and bloom during the spring and summer months.
